author: plusbj46
title: Brilliant treatment
body:
The treatment I have been provided by the team on 2 South has been brilliant. They are all very caring and great at providing rehabilitation as it was needed due to having a stroke not so long ago.  
This was a scary experience for me as it was my first one but staff have been very good at talking to me about this and trying to reassure me and support me through this difficult time. They have also been a great source of comfort and support to my family which really means a lot and shows that they not only take care of the patient but our loved ones as well. Margaret and Emily have been there for me throughout and they are my main nurses who come in and check on me and keep my family up-to-date. They have helped guide my family through the maze of supporting me after my stroke. They have worked very long hours with no complaints, and have always kept very positive on shift!  
The physios that also come in to me have been working very hard to help me get walking again and have been going beyond the norm to support me.  
They all had to work through these difficult times of covid with no complaints at all. Although I cannot wait to be discharge, the team has been absolutely fantastic and I wouldn’t want anyone else to care for me other than them. Thank you to all of them!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Best surgery
body: All staff and doctors are very helpful. They are trying very hard in this hard time.I am very happier the service provide to my son. Really appreciated.

title: Fantastic practice, joined up thinking, caring…
body:
Amazingly good. Kind, caring, professional and efficient. My father was admitted through a&e with extreme orthopaedic trauma and a number of serious comorbidities. 
He spent time on wards 3a, 3b and 3c.The communication between teams was exceptional. The treatment was timely , fully explained and effective. The doctors , nurses and all staff were kind, caring, available ,efficient and very hard working. It’s impossible to pick out any one member of staff as nothing was too much trouble for anyone on any of the wards.
The communication between departments was excellent, everything was thought through, followed up and executed in a timely manner. Astounding for a service under such pressure. 
The discharge support on ward 3c was exceptional. We wanted to get dad home as quickly as possible with a care package that kept him safe at home. This meant him staying in hospital for a couple of days after he was fit to discharge. In a very busy ward, we were helped to arrange an appointment at another hospital while: including arranging an ambulance transfer on a strike day. The assistance received from the discharge team to organise things including living aids, checks inside the hospital,medication advice was way above  and beyond you could ever expect in a service under so much pressure. 
We can’t thank everyone enough for saving dads life , getting his infection under control and getting him safely home with the minimum of fuss and the maximum of goodwill .

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Very good and informative
body: It's the best explanation I have ever had of my forthcoming procedure at any hospital or doctors practice any where over my life time super well done pre op department all staff thank you

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding
body: Always a cheerful, patient and accommodating greeting and service from the reception /admin team. Doctors are kind and understanding and for all this I would thoroughly rate the practice as outstanding. Thank you all.

title: Superb service
body: After a day when my long term back problems seemed to be worsening 111 referred me to the ambulance service. From start to finish they were superb in the quality of care and professionalism they displayed. I can only hope this review can be positively rewarded.

readBy.name: East Of England Ambulance Service NHS Trust

author: ps0410
title: Fantastic care at Hairmyres University Hospital
body: I recently received life-saving care at Hairmyres University Hospital and cannot speak highly enough of all of the staff involved. From the moment I arrived in A&E the staff were phenomenal. In particular, Dr Bhat who arrived to perform emergency surgery, despite not even being on call the evening of the incident. She clearly explained the procedure in simple terms and instantly put myself and my husband at ease in the most stressful of circumstances. Following the surgery, she has followed up and gone above and beyond to ensure my successful recovery. She saved my life and I cannot thank her enough for the wonderful care she provided, before, during and after the surgery.

title: Great efficient friendly practice
body: I brought my mum who is 89 to see a GP at the practice -she hasn't been registered long -we left her previous gp as we could never get to see or talk to anyone .I rang on the Monday - she got an appointment Tuesday and referral for a ct scan and blood tests done the same day .the gp she saw was friendly took his time with her and couldn't have been nicer .many thanks mile lane and well done  !

title: Always great service
body: The askmygp app is great, making it very easy to get a response at your convenience. No wasted time trying to phone through and then visiting the surgery - all handled remotely and professionally.

title: Very helpful
body: Very shocked to be able to get an appointment rang at 8 o'clock and was first in the queue doctor rang back and was very helpful I have previously had bad experiences with this surgery but very happy now

author: septemberep96
title: Doctor with no compassion
body:
On the advice of 111 and out of concern, I took a woman in her seventies into AE as her sudden onset back pain deteriorated rapidly. We were met by a senior doctor whose opening gambit was how they were unlikely to be able to help, they could not prescribe any pain relief and in all likelihood would be referring her back to her GP.  
They appeared to make massive assumptions because we had to take her in a wheelchair and when we asked if they would just see her trying to walk they refused!  
We were referred to frailty team who said no because prior to this event she was not frail. The doctor was heard saying in department to nursing staff that we were unhappy. We are till sat here with no plan. Nursing staff lovely and good advocates.

title: Superb quality and professionalism
body:
I moved to the area 4 months ago and was apprehensive about moving GP’s and the practice staff as well.
As I have a number of health issues, it has been a brilliant experience to be treated so remarkably professional and with kindness and understanding.
I really feel as though the whole team care and my fears have been dispelled.
I can wholeheartedly recommend this practice without any reservations.

author: melonyg67
title: Thank you all for making it as stress free as possible
body: I took my toddler son to A&E at PRI recently where he was diagnosed with a tibia fracture after a fall. Every member of staff we met from the receptionist, Dr, nurses, auxiliary were absolutely brilliant, so kind and caring and a credit to the NHS. My son has medical issues and so sees a lot of staff so he gets a bit fed up with it all (understandably) but they were all patient with him. We were seen quickly and kept up to date with what was happening and the plan going forward. Thank you all for making it as stress free as possible for a worried mum

title: empathy?
body: I was sobbing in front of the gp and trying to get her to understand what I am feeling and what I need. She just talked about advice that's been given to me in the past which just made me feel ashamed and like I had failed somehow. She barely looked at me, didn't reflect my feelings to show empathy, didn't use any phrases to show understanding. I would have loved her to tell me she understood and to validate my feelings. I used the words "killing myself is an option" and this was not even acknowledged. Rather than feeling like I had been understood and that I had someone on my side who wanted to help me, I came away feeling like this was just another failed interaction with somebody who didn't value me enough to listen to the words I was saying or acknowledge the emotional mess I was in. I felt and still feel like I've been an inconvenience and that my experience of life doesn't matter to the health service. This kind of thing is why people actually do end up killing themselves - because in the midst of total dispair you make yourself vulnerable by reaching out for help, and end up feeling like nobody cares and that they'd rather you just keep your feelings to yourself.

title: How nice it is to have a doctors that cares
body: After years of putting up with a badly run GP, doctors and receptionist with bad attitudes, having to wait weeks for an appointment only to be told "we have 15min, so pick the most important and to make another appointment for the rest". I finally had enough, and moved to the Caversham Practice before Christmas and I couldn't be happier. The doctors actually care, don't make you feel like an inconvenience, make the time to see you, and follow up on treatment rather than handing out pills never spoken to again. The whole team go above and beyond to make sure you get the care you need. I couldn't be happier, amazing doctors, amazing service, a true credit to the NHS, especially in these challenging times. Thank you!

title: Very Efficient!
body: Called at 2pm for a GP call back and was called by the Dr 10 minutes later. Very understanding and efficient. Anti-viral tablets prescribed and eye care instructions given in case of worsening symptoms. I collected the medication from my chosen pharmacy within 30 minutes! Thank you Wallington Family Practice!

title: Amazing mental health care
body: I have had the most remarkable care from the whole heam including the receptionist who always has a smile,CPNs and doctors. I am so grateful.

readBy.name: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust

title: Professional and reassuring throughout
body:
I was extremely apprehensive prior to my cataract operation. On the day of the operation I was treated professionally - from being greeted at Reception right through to seeing the Discharge Nurse once the operation was over. I was asked at all stages if I had any questions - and where I did they were answered fully.
SpaMedica at Stockton made the whole experience extremely positive. 
I await my 4 week post operative check currently and have no qualms about returning for my other eye to be treated.
Thank you NHS!

title: Great service
body: I am really happy with the support received from one of the receptionists every time I have to call to book an appointment. It is a daunting experience and she makes it easy every time. Her calm manner and patience reduce the stressful experience. She has always been kind and very responsive on the phone, and for that, I am very grateful :) Thank you!

title: Good experiences all round
body: The telephone receptionists are very friendly and understanding.  My female doctor listened attentively and understood my issues on two recent occasions and I felt very reassured.   I had clear explanations and did not feel rushed.

title: Good experience
body:
My elderly mum who is registered blind, post strokes, hearing and mobility challenges visited the Royal eye infirmary outpatients yesterday at Derriford hospital.
She was dreading going as she is so frail but the staff were very efficient and friendly.
They explained each process to her slowly and clearly which made the whole process bearable for her.
We would both like to thank all of the nursing staff and consultant for their compassion and efficiency.
She didn't feel left out of any conversations that happened 
Thank you

author: browserjc79
title: Outpatients appt North Devon District Hospital
body:
The process seemed efficient, and smooth. Information was conveyed clearly and I was able to ask all my questions and get good answers.  
2 comments/suggestions:  
The appt confirmation letter did not arrive till after the event, despite 1st class post. I found it really necessary as well as phone and/or email confirmation.  
I don't know the exact set-up for sure, but i feel it might be worth considering, if it's necessary to have a nurse allocated to each doctor to call patients through. Would fewer, less medically trained staff be a more efficient use of resources.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: OWDSYKO
title: Unsatisfactory discharge process
body:
In Jan 2023 I was admitted to Wythenshawe hospital for a sudden increase in pain from a previously diagnosed pelvic injury. The treatment I received was excellent, After an MRI scan several broken vertebra were detected.  
My pain relief was reviewed and adjusted, with good effective results. A consultant clearly explained that no hospital treatment other than pain relief was available, which would allow me to function until nature healed the bones.  
I was then diagnosed with osteoporosis and future treatment would be arranged. The hospital then carried out comprehensive assessment of my ability to care for myself at home. I was told I was fully competent and safe and sufficiently mobile with aid of walking frame for independent living and my premises were safe and fit for purpose.  
I was then told I would be discharged home. Shortly afterwards two porters arrived with wheelchair and I was taken to discharge lounge. All my belongings were assembled and checked correct, and I was given supply of new pain relief prescription and directed to comfortable chair and given hot drink to await ambulance. I felt my treatment up to this point was excellent.  
After a short wait an ambulance driver called for me and I was taken to ambulance by wheelchair and transferred to seat in ambulance. I expected to be driven home a short distance about 3 miles. I was surprised to to be driven a much shorter distance and stopped in front of a large building with sign over Opal house. I had never head of this but assumed it was a secondary ambulance waiting area. I was wheeled inside past a reception desk although none of the staff spoke to me I was wheeled into a large lounge area and deposited in a rather uncomfortable chair at the rear. The ambulance man then left. I had no walking frame so I was unable to move from that spot.  
After a wait of around 2 hours no one had attempted in any way to communicate with me other than catering assistant who offered hot drink. I had never before heard of Opal house with no idea at all of its function, or why I had been taken there. I understood that I had been formally discharged from Wythenshaw hospital to be taken home.  
I eventually managed to attract the attention of someone in a nurses uniform, I enquired where was I and why, and when was my ambulance coming to take me home. They replied that I was at opal house for assessment. In further conversation I was told opal house was an assessment centre and had no direct connection to wWthenshaw hospital. Assessment was expected to take a week or more.  
I was devastated at this and explained I had been fully assessed as safe for discharge home, and had been told by both a hospital consultant and a doctor that I was to be discharged directly home. There was never any mention of any sort of further assessment centre, or any sort of consultation, I did not know such an establishment existed. I said I wanted to leave and be taken home.  
I was then told I could not leave and was cautioned not to attempt this as access door was locked and would not be unlocked for me. I then realised that I had been transferred without my knowledge or permission to some sort of unknown assessment centre, and I was now behind locked doors.  
I repeated my desire to leave and be taken home immediately. The nurse then left, and some time later I was approached by another nurse in a different uniform which I assumed meant they were some kind of supervisor. They asked for confirmation that I wanted to leave which I confirmed. They then stated that I was self discharging and the NHS was had no further duty of care, nor would an ambulance be provided. However, as a courtesy, a taxi would be provided to take me home.  
I was then completely confused, how could I self discharge from an organisation which a few minutes ago did not know existed nor had I completed or consented to any form of admission procedure?  
Some 2 hours later with no sign of promised taxi I telephoned my son who was approaching end of his work shift, and asked him to collect me. When my son arrived I was again told I could not leave as the shift was changing - I did not see how this was relevant to allowing me to go. Some time later I was told I could go. I again protested that a small car was not suitable transportation for patient with severe pelvic and spinal injuries I also expressed my concern at anticipated difficulty of transfer from car to house in the dark with plummeting below freezing temperature a snow and ice covered sloping driveway. this was an obvious significant safety hazard for me. The reply was the NHS no longer had any duty of care and that no ambulance would be provided.  
I then transferred myself with some difficulty from wheelchair to car and was driven slowly home. I was initially optimistic of my ability to walk with aid of frame from car to house with support from my son, the distance was a little less than that negotiated in hospital assessments. However the conditions were very different I was very very cold in flimsy hospital pyjamas. Just over half way I became exhausted and my legs started to buckle. My son was unable to prevent me falling to ground. My son then obtained assistance from neighbours who managed to get me into my living room. Probable damage from this fall has yet to be fully assessed.

author: Anxious relation
title: The care of patients
body:
I just read a story on your site from three years ago about the nursing care on one of the Vascular wards in Morriston Hospital, Swansea. I’m not sure what happened as a result of the author's concern at the time but things do not seem to have improved.  
Like him I have found the vascular team helpful but the nursing regime is poor indeed. Not only has it been tantamount to negligent, the demeanour and attitude of some of the senior staff has been confrontational, defensive and failing to understand the case before discussing it.  
They have attempted to discuss my relatives case with us from a position of certainty when it has become self evident they have not read the notes or familiarised themselves with the detail.  
Communication and coordination of care has been poor. A determination to rush to prioritise discharge has blinded the nursing staff to the obvious.  
Since expressing concerns through an intermediary things have improved somewhat but I can’t help feeling it’s because the nursing staff now feel under scrutiny.  
It is appalling that at a time of great stress we have had to divert energy and time to countering the deficiencies in the nursing by having to raise such concerns.  
Given the similarity between my experience and the author from 3 years ago I can’t help but feel nothing has been learnt and the deficiencies must be at a leadership and institutional level.  
Dealing with individual cases without seeing them as an example of systemic and leadership failure will not save people like us having to suffer repeated experiences of neglect and poor nursing care.  
For clarity I am not referring to ward R. It all falls far short of what we should expect from the nursing professionals.  
I recognise the strain in the system and the pressure on individuals but we can’t allow this to be a hiding place for bad practice. In spite of the constrains we should be able to rely on professional and compassionate care for our loved ones when they are at their most vulnerable.

author: Erik12
title: I want to say unlimited thanks from all my heart. You are the best.
body:
I have seen Dr Pace and his team for 15 years.  
My health is getting worse slowly but they always make my moral-hope-happiness level up whenever I see them. They are always polite, kind helpful and make me feel happy.I want to say unlimited thanks from all my heart. You are the best.Thank you so much for caring and helping me to find the best care for my health problem.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Reception Staff and Nurses
body: In these times of changes to how we make an appointment to see our Gp’s I would like to thank the great reception staff and nurses at both the surgeries. It has always been my experience as a long time patient at this practice but more so in the past two years. This morning in particular I had such a lovely experience when I phoned the Escreet Grove surgery. I know I can’t name names but she will know who she is. The call was dealt with in a sympathetic, professional and caring way. The advice regarding making an Gp appointment going forward and actually getting another appointment booked with the nurse. The phone call to the surgery really solved my issues today. Thank you very much for your understanding and please know that you all are appreciated.

author: Sophie888
title: Urgent care
body:
We came into urgent care today with my toddler who had suffered burns from a cup of coffee.  
The staff were so brilliant and helpful. We were seen quickly by a nurse and a doctor. Several nurses came in to help calm him down while reassuring me too. They dressed his leg and he was much more comfortable. I can’t rate the service high enough today, it was fantastic.  
Thank you.

title: A caring and professional practice
body: This is a wonderful surgery, motivated by a strong ethos of helping the patients. We are all aware of the growing demands and pressures on NHS GP's, however this practice continues to strive to achieve excellence, and does in my experience. It is a Surgery that is very much in demand because it provides such a wonderful service. The doctors are kind and listen to the patient and fully meet their needs, in a professional manner. I have not had any difficulty making an appointment and the receptionists have been very good in seeking to place me with my preferred doctor, although they are all excellent. I have also used the online service which is very easy and the staff are more than happy to help with any technical difficulties and help people who don't have the facilities to use the online system. I cannot thank the practice enough for all it has done to help me.

author: Newqt83
title: Our first baby
body:
The quality of care we revived from the maternity team was outstanding. Everyone from the nurses, midwives, consultants, cleaning and catering staff were so friendly, helpful and kind.  
We had a very long labour (4 days)! My wife felt safe and cared for by everyone. We had a very intense final push and the baby Dr’s and midwives were supportive, professional and CARING.  
I honestly cannot fault the staff, they all went the extra mile and even spent valuable time with us showing breastfeeding techniques and general baby care.  
Thank you to all from the bottom of our hearts.

author: sam58
title: Lisburn Phlebotomy hub
body:
I attended the Lisburn Phlebotomy Hub to give blood. As I live in Lisburn the Hub was very convenient for me and saved at least 1 hour 45 minutes return traveling time to the Ulster Hospital, not to mention the associated cost of petrol. Car parking at the Hub was also very good compared to the extremely busy parking delays at the Ulster Hospitial.  
The nurse on duty was friendly and I was quickly put at ease. Please keep this service in operation as it is far more convenient and less stressful than having to travel to the Ulster Hospital.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great care and compassion
body:
I called the surgery back in November 2022, I got through the reception staff and completely broke down on the phone to them. They handled my situation with the upmost care and urgency and got me and appointment that same morning.
I have been under the care of the Doctor since November, I wouldn’t be here today if it wasn’t for the care I received and the correct mental health treatment.
A wonderful surgery with a great set of Drs

title: Good Service
body:
I am fortunate to be healthy and a very infrequent user of the NHS. In the last 5 years, I have had to contact the Vine Medical Group twice, once in September 2021 and today. On both occasions, all the staff with whom I have had contact, administrative and clinical, have been helpful, polite and cheerful. When there was a perceived need for me to be seen physically, this was done in a timely and accommodating manner and the subsequent referral to the specialist was completed that evening. Today’s experience was seamless and efficient - telephoned this morning at 8.10am, reserved my place in the queue for a callback, spoke with a very helpful receptionist about 20 minutes later who sent me a link to send a photo of my injury and booked me a telephone consultation for between 2-3pm. The GP called at 2.04pm, was knowledgeable, kind and reassuring, and he sent the prescription required to my local pharmacist for collection after 4pm.
I know that some people are having difficulties but, on the two occasions I have needed the services of a GP in the last 5 years, I have been impressed with the efficiency and speed with which Vine Medical Group has responded. 
Thank you.

title: Good GPs, awful admin process
body: GPs are great but it can take you hours and hours of calls to get through.  If you work then good luck because you'll need it.   Online portal a complete shambles from surgery side.  been patient for 18 years yet still had to go in person with passport when they change web portal to prove I am me.  Took four months from that to get new log in details and the wrong! Admin side is utterly poor for this surgery

title: Got Mental health issues? Stay away!!!
body: I admittedly missed a Mental health review, as a result I was told to call in as they don't accept general appointments currently through SystemOnline to rearrange. (God himself only knows why) to then be told to struggle with the daily fight of getting through on the phone 8, yes 8 times to rearrange, leaving me, a vulnerable individual without necessary medication and support. I will be leaving the surgery in due course because of this.

author: plutojj68
title: Good support form the Perinatal Mental Health Service
body:
I have suffered with severe depression and anxiety for most of my life, and have seen multiple specialists. When I found out I was pregnant, I was referred to the perinatal team and started working with Jen. I can honestly say she is the first professional to have had a positive impact on me and really help. I wouldn’t have made it through my pregnancy without her support, I genuinely cannot thank her enough!  
I would recommend anyone struggling with their mental health throughout pregnancy/motherhood to reach out because it has been so worth it. Jen was non-judgmental and listened to what I had to say, challenged me when necessary and helped me to work through the situations without causing me distress, I will forever be grateful for her support!

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Psdoffrelative
title: Frustrating time contacting outpatients
body:
I have spent the past 3 hours 45 minutes trying, to get through to outpatients appointments for urology in the New Victoria Glasgow. The numbers on the letter either constantly ring out with no answer or a answer machine cuts in asking for an extension number, which there is not one on the letter.  
I find it unacceptable that not one person has answered the phone numbers on the appointment letter in all that time. I understand the NHS is busy but for no clerical staff to answer a phone in that length of time is extremely poor practice. No wonder people just don’t turn up for appointments when they can not get an answer on the phone after constantly trying for nearly 4hours. Is there a clerical strike within GGC that we have not been informed about?  
If no one answers by lunchtime there will be another non show appointment tomorrow, not through my lack of trying to contact to rearrange appointment but through lack of staff not answering the phone numbers quoted on appointment letters. This is a gross mis-management of patients and NHS time

author: Suzystr
title: Everyone had a smile and an empathetic ear
body: My son attended A&E yesterday morning with an injured knee. He was treated with empathy and care to the highest level. Staff kept him informed of each assessment, how things would progress and were extremely kind and empathetic. Fantastic job done guys! Can’t thank you all enough for your expertise and care. From the lady in the shop, receptionists, porters nurses and doctors - everyone had a smile and an empathetic ear and did everything to make him comfortable - Absolutely outstanding.

author: well impressed mum
title: Well cared for by top notch professionals
body:
Our experience of our son being initially treated for broken leg - timely ambulance arrival to transport him to Royal Infirmary Edinburgh, children's A&E (on a Saturday) - speedy initial admission, assessed immediately followed by xray within 30 mins max. Results again very speedy - consultant paged and appeared within 45 mins - proposed surgery, happened within 2 hours. All staff attentive, communications brilliant. Overnight stay with staff very visible, hands on and communicative. Slight delay before Physio appeared on Sunday but was well communicated by staff.  
Unfortunately he then became unwell 3/4 days later - phoned NHS24 just after 6pm - had out of hours doctor appt at 7:30pm at RAH paisley - told to go to RHC glasgow - triaged within 1 hour and Ortho doc came about an hour later - slight delay in defining plan - but obs taken and cast removed - identified infection with full bloods then taken - results of high white blood count came back quickly, which initiated more tests and overnight stay required. A slight hiccup when pencillin administered very quickly - blood pressure and oxygen sats plummeted - doctors immediately appeared, assessed, monitored and reassured - made sure he was stable before moving on  
Admitted to ward 3C RHC (ortho) and again great experience - nurses were very busy ( full ward) but always had time to answer many questions, Doctors were brilliant, again always willing to answer questions communication between doctors, nurses, technicians, ultrasound, microbiology etc. could not be faulted - teamwork was brilliant !! For example, within 2 hours of doctor ward round - we had wheelchair technician appear, new brace appeared - all effortless ( from my viewpoint)  
I felt I had to comment on such a positive, experience where all services obviously interacted so brilliantly. The doctors were brilliant, all so approachable, covered all bases medically with great communication skills (F1 doctor was brilliant with my son) Nurses were obviously very, very busy but always made time for us. At what could be a stressful time the staff made my son and I feel very well cared for by top notch professionals . Thank you to all staff !

author: apusjj79
title: Greatly appreicated
body:
I was referred to the Lymphoedema department after breast cancer.  
I had Jane who was very supportive and happily taught me a range of strategies to use to help reduce my breast lymphoedema and after a few months I managed to keep it under control.  
Many thanks for all your time, patience and support given. Greatly appreciated.

author: Marino10
title: Exceptional care
body:
My recent visit to Dermatology Department, Litchdon House:  
I do not have a major problem. However, the specialist consultant, nurse and receptionist are awesome people, kind and extremely professional, with that excellent humanity that only comes with being exceptional at your work (knowledge and ability).  
I know there are many thoughtless 'knockers' out there, but when you need help, and you get help at this level of excellence, I can only say; thank you, inadequate as that simple statement seems to me.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Sheels10
title: Helpful exercise programme after cancer care.
body: I have undertaken twelve weeks of exercise class and have found them very beneficial. The exercises give me an all round work out at a pace I can tolerate.   The discipline of the class really helps  - having a set time each week. I find the instructor to be very encouraging and I feel safe during the session

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Johxh33
title: Excellent work from all the team
body:
Was given a chance to accept a cancellation appointment at short notice. Yes please was my reply it was for 09:45 on Monday morning.  
Arrived early to allow me plenty time to park and walk to the hospital, all good. I was about 30 minutes early, got taken straight away. I saw my first nurse, Alison, who was excellent , then passed on to Louise and her colleague to get the rest of my tests done.  
All done by 10:03 excellent work from everyone. Thank you all for everything and best wishes

author: cyclonedt84
title: A&E Reception
body:
Whilst in the queue at A&E a couple moved forward to the glass where a member of staff was working and were told that they were at the wrong window/in the wrong queue. They then stepped back to rejoin the original queue but were told very loudly by the staff member to go to the back of the other queue, even though this would not have been correct. There was an insinuation that they had tried to jump the queue which was not the case. I stepped in and said that they were in front of me. I felt that they were being humiliated and I was embarrassed and ashamed that they were being treated this way.  
Again the couple did not speak English well and I had concerns that they may have been treated differently had this not been the case. When they did get to the counter I could hear them say that the lady was pregnant and that she was losing blood and in severe pain and therefore concerned about losing a baby. It made me feel very sad for several days thinking about how worried they must have been and that they were treated in this way.

author: cyclonedt84
title: Accident and emergency reception
body: Whilst I was waiting in A&E a young child, who looked to be aged about 8 years old, was used to interpret for an adult at the reception desk. Reception staff spoke very loudly and slowly to the adult and child in English and other people waiting to be seen could hear. This included reprimanding them for not having the current address recorded correctly on the system.

author: Feeling good!
title: They showed nothing but care and compassion
body:
I came into QEH in January overnight. In a 999. Paramedics fantastic.  
I was met by A&E staff/team who assured me the whole time about my breathing and began to help immediately. I was very distressed as my breathing was so bad. They showed nothing but care and compassion as I would have tried the best patience of any clinician. I was scared though. Breathing brought under control and I was transferred to level 7. Care 1st class all the way. Kathrine and Annam SN - nothing is a problem. Thanks to respiratory nurse and doctors and lovely care staff who look after you while you get better. Love NHS❤️‍🩹❤️‍🩹❤️‍🩹

author: Argyllrover
title: I’m well on the mend
body:
I was assessed at RAH paisley and told I needed cataract surgery, firstly to my right eye and then my left eye ( still to be done ) .  
I felt it took a long time getting to the day of surgery, but with that said the day of surgery arrived .  
I was sent an appointment for the Vale of Leven day surgery unit . Not ideal but a small price to pay to get the surgery needed .  
On arrival quite early in the morning we found the arrivals desk was not yet open, the cleaning lady that was on duty kindly showed us to where we needed to be, thank you kindly .  
Straight off the minute we walked into the dept we were treated very kindly with the staff member on the entrance to the day unit . Felt at ease 100%, no awareness whatsoever, was then introduced to Tracy who dealt with me from start to finish, Tracy was a very kind person , nothing was a problem to her, felt at ease with her, my wife was not able to come into the unit, so a friendly face was well needed, Was at ease and she took me through the steps to having my surgery done. She took me to the place I was to be operated on and was at the ward when I arrived back at the day surgery unit, she then finished off by getting me ready to go home when my wife arrived to take me home.  
If anyone is reading this with any worries about this surgery, please do not worry about this procedure at all, it’s totally painless and the result is fantastic even 30 minutes after getting it done, I’m now 5 days after the operation I’m well on the mend, thanks to every single one of the NHS staff right down to the lovely cleaning lady, but mostly Tracy. Many Thanks .

author: SukiMunns
title: Well informed and in safe hands
body:
One of my back teeth started to fall apart and was painful causing an abscess. I contacted my regular dentist only to find they had booted me off without warning. I am a diabetic and with pain in my mouth I wasn’t able to eat properly, well one thing led to another ending up with me being admitted via A&E with DKA (diabetic ketoacidosis).  
I was referred to the Oral and Maxillofacial Department for an emergency extraction and they couldn’t have been more lovely! They made me feel at ease with their lovely caring manner. I wear partial dentures and some dentists have made me feel uneasy about this but these guys were amazing. Checking on my well being every step of the way. During the procedure I felt very informed and in safe hands at all times. Nothing was too much trouble. Rick, Sammy and Seraphina are a credit to your team :)

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Pizzapeter2468
title: Very happy with the whole experience
body: Nurse McDonald in the sexual health clinic was very kind and patient regarding some personal issues and questions I was nervous about. She took the time to answer and explore options with me regarding sexual health, a subject that can be a bit taboo at times. Very happy with the whole experience

title: Excellent service
body: I want to thank the receptionist/care navigator and practice nurse for their brilliant support and generous spirit as they 'went the extra mile' for me yesterday. They were receptive and found a solution for which I'm really grateful. Working in primary care myself, I know how challenging it is to meet all your patient needs. You're doing an excellent job. Thank you, again!

title: Poor mental health service
body: Waited at least a month and 2 cancellations for an appointment. Appointment only 15 mins in length and was only so that I could be asked to self refer to MindsMatter. Mental health nurse was very keen to push me onto a talking therapy. No other option explored. I have felt a lot worse since I attended.

title: Great Local Medical Practice
body: I had a review for my Asthma by phone and the nurse recommended me for a health check as I was due one. I got an appointment within 2 days at the medical centre. It was before work so very convenient and I was one of the first patients to be seen. The Nurse did some tests and we discussed my health since the last check up and recommendations on diet and exercise and general wellbeing. I was impressed at getting an appointment so quickly.

title: Contact is very difficult
body:
Calling at 1 second past 8am after a long automated service you are told that there is over 150 calls already and the phone hangs up. Following that it’s then engauged 

Asking for an automated call back the next day 15th in the queue and some 3 1/2 hour later you get a call back only to be told there are no appointments try again tomorrow 

It shouldn’t be a Lottery ! 

I tried several times in November only to be told there were no appointment, was offered 1 at a practice 5 miles away but on a day when I already had another appointment. 

Eventually got an appointment with a “practitioner” not a Dr on 8th January again after a 55 minute call wait

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Surgery went well
body:
I am very happy with the care that I have been experiencing so far as I truly feel the care I get is great and they have treated me brilliantly since I was admitted.  
Having surgery recently was pretty good and I was told that surgery went well after being very nervous about it. However my nerves were reassured before the surgery. Recovery ward was good and helped out.  
Staff have been brilliant like I really can't say a bad word about any of them as they're excellent and I have been very happy with the care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Amazing hospital
body: I feel I have experienced the best of care, from reception to leaving the hospital. Everything was efficient , friendly and  reassuring, removing any stress I might have felt. All procedures were fully explained and questions were encouraged and replied to in the most friendly way. All staff introduced themselves , and while in recovery any staff going by was either offering refresments, or checking I was fine, all making eye contact with me which is very important. There were no delays at any time. I have come home with a very clear plan of action for wound care and pain mangement ( I am lucky to experience very little pain so far). I feel I have received 5 star treatment from amazing professional. I will fully recommend Blakesland Hospital to any one asking my opinion. Thank you to the whole team, a shing example of how it should be done everywhere.

author: scoreboardqy44
title: Non-judgemental support
body:
Covid forced working from home, boredom and loneliness. I enjoyed a very occasional drink, pre covid, however, knowing I would be driving to work everyday, I would only have a drink occasionally at weekends. I could take it or leave it.  
During covid my drinking became more and more frequent. It was both a form of relaxation and escapism initially. But then one drink became two to a bottle of wine a few nights a week. I began struggling to get up for early morning teams meetings and when I did I couldn't think clearly and people would ask if I was OK, due to sounding coarse and croaky. My drinking became more and more frequent with larger amounts being consumed. It began affecting my work and family relationship.  
My emotions were all over the place and I felt lonely, low with a promise to myself almost every morning, that today was the day I would not have a drink and break the cycle.  
On really bad hangover days, it was easier to refrain, however, day two when the effects wore off, the craving around 4/5pm commenced. I'd feel guilty due to telling family I'd cut back and quit, but would then start again. I'd try to buy little bottles of wine and tell myself that's it, once it's gone, however, living very close to a shop made it easy to purchase more. I also began to drink in secret so my family weren't aware, but now realise, the only person I was really deceiving was myself.  
This had to stop. I referred myself to italk, not realising they don't support unhealthy alcohol related matters. They did however sign post me to local support groups, 1-2-1,and inclusion.  
I began 1-2-1 meetings with inclusion which was embarrassing for me personally, that it had come to that, however, they were so friendly non judgemental and supportive, I actually looked forward to my meetings.  
Inclusion provided a multitude of areas to support me and my situation. They provided support for low self esteem and addictive behaviours, and to break cycles and build confidence.  
It hasn't been plain sailing, it's been hard at times, but I'm in a much better place, mentally and physically and not so hard or critical of myself. I've developed coping strategies, from meetings, courses and support. I've learnt to say no thank you, when in public places where colleagues push alcohol.

title: Terrible service
body: Firstly, GPs at this surgery are fantastic, can't fault them. However receptionist staff are rude and intrusive. Every time I phone the surgery they want to know specifically what is wrong with you before they 'decide' you can have an appointment. What happened to patient confidentiality? I was particularly upset with the way I was treated when I took my daughter to surgery Jan 2023. I was told to put on a mask or I would not be able to see a doctor in surgery. No other patient in the waiting room had one on nor did any member of staff working behind the reception desk, which I have no problem with since covid is now something we have to live with. However, I felt singled out; my anxiety levels raised tenfold as I do not like confrontation but felt I had to question why me?? The enforcement of mask wearing in surgeries was dropped sometime in June 2022 so I'm not sure why they are continuing with this regimented way of practice. Because of this hostility, I have put off a cervical screening appointment which was due sept 2022. I have been online to make a formal complaint to the practice manager but there is no email option for this. Instead it invites you to speak to reception which is entirely the issue!!

title: Caring, non judgemental
body:
All of the staff I had contact with were very professional, sympathetic and caring. The general atmosphere of the unit was one of optimism and positivity.
I was transferred to Chapman Barker from my local hospital and was to be given a 7 day detox for alcohol withdrawal - some patients stay a little longer if their admission is planned via engagement with local alcohol services.
From the moment I arrived I was put at ease, given a quick explanation of what to expect during my stay and was shown to my single room, before being administered medication to combat withdrawal symptoms. I was very weak and unwell for the first couple of days at the unit but received good support and encouragement from staff and fellow patients alike. After this I was able to take part in the group dicussions and activities which were also very helpful. By the time i was discharged my health and outlook was much improved.
Thankyou Chapman Barker for starting me down the path of sobriety and, although I'm only about 6 weeks dry at this point I hope to be in a position to notify you of a much longer span of abstinence in future.

title: Excellent nurse
body: The nurse at the practice really put my daughter at ease when having her bloods done, she was friendly, professional and really showed she cared.

title: Thank you for helping me
body:
I'm a new patient and recently needed help with getting back onto medication for mental health. 
I had read negative reviews so I was a little anxious whether I would be heard but after I called asking for an appointment I was called back by the doctor within half an hour. My doctor really helped me feel listened to and prescribed for me immediately.
Thank you so much, especially with how I feel as of lately it couldn't have been handled any better.
Thank you again!

title: Great practice
body: I am a new patient and so far the experience with the practice has been great.  Very clean premises, the staff is respectful and nice and doctors listen to you carefully and take their time to visit you. I would highly recommend this practice

title: Wonderful Team
body:
I felt really taken care of by this wonderful team. What a fantastic team of nurses and doctors. They reassured me and put me at ease from the moment I set foot in the department. The angiogram was flawless and I would like to  reassure anyone coming in for the same procedure to not worry . They will
Look after you brilliantly.

title: Fantastic
body: I have been with biddlestone since I moved to Newcastle and they have always managed to fit me and my daughter in and never wait too long for an appointment. The Drs and nurses show empathy and care and never make you feel silly and take you seriously. Even through trying times for the nhs  they are always there and always helpful and I feel very lucky.

title: Great practice
body: Was really nice the recepitist understood my concerns was really helpful would recommend this doctors always nice and polite

author: Vicbra91
title: Positive experience
body:
I attended the endoscopy clinic for a colonoscopy after being referred by my GP. It was my first time experiencing this and I was incredibly nervous. The staff were fantastic with me, everyone from the receptionist to the nurses, they were so reassuring and kind.  
In the examination room, Trish the lead nurse was so kind and chatty and put me at ease. Nurse Karen held my hand and chatted to me during the procedure. What was initially a nerve wracking experience turned out to be so positive and I can't thank everyone enough!

title: Best GP practice I've used
body:
The Womens Health doctor here has been so helpful and understanding.  I was given the required medication for peri-menopause.  I recommend anyone needing peri or menopause help to ask for the doctor who deals with Womens Health. 
Thank you!

title: Careing mental health
body: Today I was contacted by a mental health professional.  She was caring and pleasant .and helpful.she explained the next step ,an assessment over the telephone and about form to fill in on the computer but assured me if I couldn't do it on my phone not to worry.

title: Brilliant staff
body: My daughter went in for a day dental procedure on the children’s ward at Pinderfields and I have to say a massive thank you to all staff who cared for her especially as she is very challenging due to her disabilities .I cannot praise them high enough as they really went out of their way to make it as stress free as possible for her ,especially the Dentist and the Anaesthetist who were fab with her and so kind .At a time when the NHS is having so mainly complaints credit where and when it’s due ,in this instance I couldn’t fault it

title: Caring and Efficient
body: I visited the department with my daughter who was very unwell. She was triaged and immediately taken to a cubicle to be cannulated. The Receptionist, Consultant, Doctor, Support Worker were all amazing, they were thorough, efficient and explained everything perfectly. The department was so busy and the staff are clearly under pressure but nothing was too much trouble for them. Thank you so much for your wonderful care.

title: Amazing service
body: I just wanted to say a big thank you to all the staff in the maternity unit. All of the midwife’s were reassuring and made me feel at ease including those in the day care unit. I had a c section and all the staff involved were amazing and the after care received was all very positive. Thank you again.

title: Great
body: Managed to get an appointment and be seen the same day. Dr was understanding of my need to be seen before an imminent trip abroad.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care has been good and bad
body:
The care that I have been getting so far at least has been pretty great just a few complaints with the consistency of the night staff. I am paralyzed from the waist down so require a lot of extra care however I feel like the night staff change regularly so having to explain care everyday to these is a hassle and can cause difficulties with things such as care. The day staff are great though like they really go above and beyond.  
Foods also been amazing- I can't have gluten and this hospital everyday goes above and beyond to meet my needs with lovely food made for me and tailored to my need. Its amazing and I want to thank the staff for this.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Not bad
body:
My experience this time was good liked the newish doctor and med student.
Medication review (don't think I've had one before) only been at that practice for 40 years !!!

title: Great experience
body: Needed an urgent prescription, called the GP and the prescription was immediately sent to my pharmacy - excellent service. Always find the GP's here very helpful

title: Excellent practice
body: Excellent from start to finish I would recommend you I was very scared to begin with but put at ease throughout. Pre.operative consultation was excellant. Praise for receptionists nurses doctors and all concerned. Thanks to everyone for my cataract operation.

title: Fast and efficent
body: I rang for an appointment at 8.00am today (25.1.23) and was seen at 10.15, with follow up blood tests done an hour later. The service was fast, efficient and friendly. Thank you to the Doctors and Nurses of the Charlbury Medical Centre.

author: ospreyjc96
title: Comfortable and looked after
body:
I attended Holly Bank ward at Cannock Chase Hospital to have a Epidural Steroid injection in January2023.  
I would like to commend all the staff who were very friendly and professional, I felt very comfortable and was well looked after. Toast and a hot drink were very welcome when I came back from theatre.  
In particular Rebecca was extremely helpful nothing was too much trouble  
I would not hesitate to recommend this hospital in future

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

title: Very good practice
body: We moved to Helston at the end of last year and have had nothing but helpful and courteous service from Helston Medical Centre. In our experience they make every effort to call or see you if there is a problem and both the medical staff and receptionists are so friendly and helpful. A vast improvement on our previous practice.

title: Prescriptions
body: This GP keeps rejecting prescriptions for no reason at all. I am diabetic and I keep missing my medication because they kept rejecting my request, I only request for my meds as per Patient Access app which the GP set up themselves. Why set up a date to request for prescriptions for patients only for them to reject it! It's beyond me! Obviously, patients' wellbeing is not their priority, I guess this GP wants their patients get worst not better.

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Female surgical stay
body:
I am here a week yesterday. The doctors say I have made a great improvement which is good. I’m feeling a bit better thankfully. I wasn’t a bit well at all.  
The staff have all been incredible. I couldn’t fault any of them at all. They are extremely helpful. I’m trying to be a little more independent and relying on them less, but I know they are there if I need them.  
My only complaint would be that it is hard to get a good sleep. The ward is always busy. There is nothing like your own bed though.  
I’m trying my best to eat but I really don’t have much of an appetite. But the food seems very nice and very well presented.  
I’ll be glad to get home and start to feel better and back to my own routine.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

author: Colww35
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Great staff doctors nurses and everyone involved
body: Great staff doctors nurses and everyone involved with me I could not Praise them enough. Nothing could off been better all was good with the care I got. Good on the ward 1 North you don't have to ask twice for help they are all there for you. All staff do a great job they are on the game at all times The food was great when I got my appetite back no complaints at all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: satisfactory visit
body:
Hello
Because I am not a Physician, I am unable to comment on the procedures, recommendations, and medication determined during my visit.
I can ,however comment on the way that I was treated in the Eurology Department.
All of the Staff were courtious, helpful, and very professional. I could not have asked for, or have received better attention, for which I am most gratefull
Kind Regards
R Whittington

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

author: Swepc36
title: Always had a smile on their faces.
body:
After fracturing my pelvis and returning home, I then developed an infection and returned to hospital. I was then sent to STH Ward 2 to get stronger and have some rehab. Today I am going to a nursing home, but I want to say how wonderful all the staff were during my time here.  
Never before in my long life (in am in my nineties) have I come across such kindness and patience and understanding as I have from all the ward staff. I have seen them tempted to the limit but always had a smile on their faces.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great every time we’ve needed help
body: As a parent to several children and with a disabled Mother this practise has always gone above and beyond for me and all of my family. They understand mothers intuition and make the right call every single time. I have always found the call navigators understanding and pass on all relevant information to be analysed by a clinician or GP. The call backs are on time and visits to the medical centre I find it clean and tidy and rarely running behind. I couldn’t wish to be at a better, more understanding practise. I know everyone will have their own experience but I can’t fault the help I receive which dates back to pre - children days at the old glades surgery too. I cannot be more grateful to the staff!

author: Colww35
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: All do an amazing job
body: All staff Doctors Nurses all do an amazing job in 3 South Stroke and everyone gets on with the job at hand. A bit quicker in finding out what is wrong with me but they are all doing there best and will get it done I am sure of it. Great in the ward had a few other patents to talk too and have a good chat. All staff do an great job and work very hard all the time. Food was super I could not ask for better.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: pelicanrn67
title: Put at ease
body: I was very nervous to have my coil removed but the nurse who did the procedure was lovely. She was very friendly and very chatty and explained everything to me before starting, very efficient and an all round a very nice lady who made me feel at ease!

title: Putting risk to my health
body: My last repeat prescription was withheld by the surgery as a result of bad management which meant the prescription was not received by my pharmacist on time which meant I was without tablets thus compromising my health.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Haven't had an issue
body:
The care that I have been getting so far has honestly been pretty decent so far and I really haven't had an issue with what I have been experiencing.  
Food has been pretty decent so far, variety has been a bit stale but happy enough with quality it's good food.  
The staff have been the best a part of my care though all just so nice and have been great with what I have seen from them-they all do such a good job being so respectful of me. They're easy enough to understand and I haven't had an issues so far

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Practice with empathy.
body:
It's kind treatment , empathic , always there to respond and doing excellent follow up . 
Encouraging and very family like friendly.

title: Great practice
body:
My GP was exemplary- every effort has been taken to research and arrange tests alleviating my health concerns. 
The Doctors, Nurse and staff make this a great practice- thank you

title: Fantastic Service
body: I had my procedure on Monday. There was no unnecessary waiting, the staff were amazing and the location was ideal.

author: septemberyz99
title: Empowering home birth
body: I had the most empowering and calm home birth I could have wished for thanks to the community midwives, especially Kerry who followed my birth plan to a T and was so caring and calm.

title: Exceptional support
body: Great response and constant support during many weeks of chest infections. X-ray referral to clinics medications and face to face and phone calls. Hospital referrals and excellent COPD discussion. Everything explained clearly during a very stressful time.

author: crocodileyj86
title: Getting the implant done
body: The staff were lovely and very good with communication, I didn’t feel scared to get it done after talking to them even though I was very nervous beforehand.

title: Eye test
body:
The team was brilliant every thing under one practice eye test / blood test / blood pressure/ and doctor brilliant experience I’m in my sixties and live locally to my practice.
So please keep it thank you.

author: lisapro89
title: Friendly and helpful staff
body:
My grandad was brought into Resus by ambulance at the start of January as he was having a heart attack. The paramedics were fantastic with my grandad who has dementia and can be a bit of a handful at times. They were very understanding and kept my grandad calm. The staff in Resus were also very professional, very efficient and kept me informed as to what was going on.  
He was then taken to CCU ward 21 where we stayed for a couple of days. The staff were brilliant. So friendly and helpful. I would like to say a special mention to Emma, Aleem and Ellie who really stood out to me over the few days that he was in ward 21.  
After a few days he was moved to ward 23, the staff here were also very helpful. As a staff member myself, I was proud to say I worked alongside these people. Thank you so much to all the staff who looked after my grandad. From my whole family, we really appreciate all your efforts.

author: Grin123
title: Copper coil
body: Staff were amazing and friendly and very gentle and quick and easy would definitely go again and would recommend them to my friends and family if they needed help

title: Always helpful and attentive
body: I have had to visit several times recently and all the staff have been helpful and attentive from the drs to the reception team and dispensers.

title: Gone downhill
body: I've been with them for 4/5 years now and used to think they were great. Not so much anymore. Its very rare to get past the reception. When you do, great. But the issue with even just speaking with one seems to be getting worse. I tried on Monday as requested by the 111 doctor at the weekend. Who prescribed antibiotics for my chest, I've got emphysema.  I'm really rough, and was refused to speak with doctor. Told to wait till antibiotics have kicked in. We'll it's Wednesday now and I still feel ill. Can't breathe properly, I've increased my inhalers myself as I don't know what else to do, my voice has gone because of them I guess, Im coughing more but I don't want to call them again. I feel that rough but the thought of calling again for help and being biffed off by the receptionists depresses me. I've lost confidence in them. And after doing a recce of the local doctors no one is saying much better of any of the others. If you are not urgently sick (sick is sick surely) it's 3 weeks for an appointment , 2 weeks for a phone appointment. Seriously. What has happened to them since covid. Because that's when it all changed. And incidently, working in customer service myself, if you dobattend the surgery, I've seen personally, the receptionists finish their gossip before they turn to ask a patient how they can help. Really builds confidence. I'm looking for another doctor, unfortunately. I used to really feel happy here. Not anymore.

title: Awful wait time
body: i had a dislocated knee and damaged ligaments and they told me i had to wait 27 week’s ridiculous wait keeping me out of work and stopping me from being able to do anything

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

author: kilowh68
title: A fantastic team
body:
My mother was admitted to QEUH Ward 7d after a nasty chest infection. She was an impatient on the ward for 13 days and the care she received was exceptional, The staff could not do enough to help, every member of staff we encountered was fantastic.  
The first few days when she was undergoing tests the nurses would come in to reassure my mother and make sure she knew what was going on at all times and to ensure she wasn’t nervous. She was taken for a broncoscopy and I was allowed to go to the ward at 7:00 am to sit with her before the procedure. Every member of staff from the HCSW to the consultants were fantastic, and every nurse made time for my mother. I know how stretched these nurses are, and particularly respiratory during the winter, but it was never shown.  
Fantastic - I can’t thank them enough.
